DOC.brief_summary: Abdominoplasty is one of the most popular body-contouring procedures, yet it is also among the most hazardous aesthetic procedures currently performed. It was shown, in many studies, to be associated with a significant complication rate, some of which are life-threatening. This study describes the investigators experience with a series of abdominoplasties performed under epidural anesthesia. Outcomes are presented, especially in terms of complication, and the practical advantages of this method are discussed.
DOC.criteria: All patients that underwent abdominoplasty between January 2003 and March 2008 in a private hospital by Dr. Yitshak Ramon. Patients with concurrent operations requiring general anesthesia.
